## Request Specification

| HTTP API                                                                                             | HTTP Method | URL Params                                          | Resource                                                     |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [INSERT](https://docs.tigrisdata.com/httpdocs/server/v1/api#tag/Documents/operation/Tigris_Insert)   | POST        | <li> Database Name </li> <li> Collection Name </li> | `/databases/{db}/collections/{collection}/documents/insert`  |
| [REPLACE](https://docs.tigrisdata.com/httpdocs/server/v1/api#tag/Documents/operation/Tigris_Replace) | PUT         | <li> Database Name </li> <li> Collection Name </li> | `/databases/{db}/collections/{collection}/documents/replace` |

### Request Payload

```shell
{
  "documents": [{doc1}, {doc2}...]
}
```

Understanding the request payload:

- The **documents** represent an array of json documents that you want to insert or replace in a collection.
